content.text:
# 31st Annie Awards

31stAnnie Awards
February 7, 2004
----
Best Feature Film:
Finding Nemo
----
Best Television Program:
The Simpsons
----
Best Home Video Production:
The Animatrix
----
Best Short Subject:
Boundin
The 31st Annual Annie Awards honoring excellence in the field of animation of 2003 were held on February 7, 2004, at the Alex Theatre in Glendale, California.
Production nominees
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Animated Feature
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Achievement in an Animated Home Entertainment Production
|-
| valign="top" |
Finding Nemo – Pixar'
* Brother Bear – Walt Disney Animation Studios
* Looney Tunes: Back in Action – Warner Bros.
* Millennium Actress – Go Fish Pictures
* The Triplets of Belleville – Les Armateurs
| valign="top" |
'The Animatrix – Silver Pictures / Warner Home Video'
* ''101 Dalmatians II: Patch's London Adventure – Disneytoon Studios
* Rolie Polie Olie: The Baby Bot Chase – Nelvana Limited / Sparkling
* Stitch! The Movie – Walt Disney Television Animation
|-
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Achievement in an Animated Short Subject
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Achievement in an Animated Television Commercial
|-
| valign="top" |
Boundin  – Pixar'
* Ananda  – Vinton Studios
* Boys Night Out  – Barley Films
* Destino – Walt Disney Pictures
* Nibbles – Acme Filmworks
| valign="top" |
'''Lamisil: "It's Alive – Wild Brain Inc.'
* Bombay "Drift" – Psyop Inc.
* Colorado Lottery "Woodcut"  – Acme Filmworks
* Wisconsin Lottery "Casino"  – Acme Filmworks
|-
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Achievement in an Animated Television Production
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Achievement in an Animated Television Production Produced For Children
|-
| valign="top" |
'The Simpsons  – Gracie Films'
* Captain Sturdy  – Renegade Animation
* The Fairly OddParents – Nickelodeon Animation Studio
* Samurai Jack – Cartoon Network Studios
* Spider-Man: The New Animated Series  – Adelaide Productions
| valign="top" |
'The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius  – Nickelodeon Productions / DNA Productions'
* ChalkZone – Nickelodeon Animation Studio
* Duck Dodgers – Warner Bros. Animation
* Jakers! The Adventures of Piggley Winks – Mike Young Productions
* ''JoJo's Circus – Cartoon Pizza / Cuppa Coffee Studios
|-
|}

Juried awards
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Winsor McCay Award
|-
| valign="top" | Gene Deitch, John Hench & Thurl Ravenscroftfor their career contributions to the art of animation
|-
!style="width=50%"|June Foray Award
|-
| valign="top" | Martha Sigallfor her significant and benevolent or charitable impact on the art and industry of animation
|-
!style="width=50%"|Ub Iwerks Award
|-
| valign="top" | Scott Johnstonfor technical advancement that has made a significant impact on the art or industry of animation
|-

|-
| valign="top" | David Derks, Mike Judge/Don Hertzfeldt
